medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain located in the left lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started slowly and grew stronger over a short period of time, with a duration of approximately 24 hours. It is constant, primarily located in the left lower quadrant and radiates to the suprapubic and right lower quadrant. The patient denies any previous history of abdominal pain, constipation, fever, chills, or night sweats, but reports few episodes of diarrhea.
